intro: Vataireopsis iglesiasii, commonly known as the Iguales mountain ash, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. The plant produces edible berries that are typically consumed by local wildlife and have been used in traditional medicine. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
